title: ag.algebraic geometry - Subgroup of $PGL(n(n-1)/2, \mathbb K)$ preserving the grassmannian $Gr(2, n)$
body: How can we determine the subgroup of $PGL(\wedge^2 \bar{\mathbb Q}^n)$ which preserves the grassmamnnian $Gr(2, n)$ embedded as a projective variety in $\wedge^2(\bar{\mathbb Q}^n)$ via the Plucker embedding. For $n = 4$ , this variety is a quadric and it is a known fact that the transformation group of $Gr(2,4)$ is the orthogonal group of the corresponding quadratic form (defined on $\bar{\mathbb Q}^6$ by a single Plucker relation). One may approach this question for $n = 5$ by considering the Plucker relations for $n = 5$ each of which yields a quadratic form and provided this is non-degenerate determine the corresponding orthogonal groups and finally take their intersection. Is this a good approach. Is there an alternative method? ag.algebraic-geometry linear-algebra grassmannians multilinear-algebra Share Cite Improve this question Follow edited Jul 12, 2020 at 10:49 asked Jul 11, 2020 at 17:12 A.
